page.title: 03Well Dressings
page.content: Well Dressings are made to give thanks for having water.A Well Dressing has flowers arranged to make a picture, usually a Biblical one. A board like a frame is used. The board may be as large as three metres square. The board is a frame that the clay is put into.The clay is puddled, a process which softens and clears the clay of grit and stones. Next the design is chosen,and the clay goes into the frame.The design is pricked onto the clay and certain plants and flowers are collected; alder cones, lichen,hydrangea,moon daisies,camomile flowers,pepper corns,geraniums and marsh reeds,are some examples.These are used to create the picture.A Welldressing usually takes a week to make and lasts for up to a week, depending on the weather.
